original: It puts the ball in the net or it gets the hose again. Absolutely amazing, have nothing negative to say about this game as it's exceeded my expectations and will probably exeed yours too. Fluid movement, bug/crash free, lots of story/content to put you through, options for each and every day such as multiple practices, events (sponsorships) and even games. This review is purely based on playing mycareer, and so far it's 10/10. Facescan worked really well for me (used it two times, first one made me have a downsyndrome forehead though..). Keep in mind, using the mynba2k17 app will allow for you to facescan for free and allow you to earn daily vc. #sellout
polished: It puts the ball in the net or it gets the hose again. Absolutely amazing, I have nothing negative to say about this game as it has exceeded my expectations and will likely exceed yours too. The game features fluid movement, is bug- and crash-free, and offers a wealth of story content and options to keep you engaged, including multiple practices, events such as sponsorships, and games. This review is based solely on my experience with MyCareer, and so far, it's a perfect 10/10. The Facescan feature worked well for me, although the first attempt resulted in an unusual forehead shape. Notably, using the MyNBA2K17 app allows for free Facescan use and daily VC earnings. #sellout

original: Magic fans beware... Wizards is afraid to make a decent digital game. At its core magic the gathering is a social game. A game to enjoy with your friends (or frenemies) laughing, talking smack, and dropping game winning bombs. Wizards of the coast seems to have forgotten this. If you choose to play with friends you cant earn gold, and gold is important. Gold is so important that they have implemented a daily cap, understandable considering gold unlocks everything in game. But get ready for a long and boring 1v1 grind against the computer or random oponents, whom you can't even speak to. If you choose to play for free, it will take you roughly 4 hours a day for upwards of a month, by yourself, to unlock the cards.
polished: Magic fans, beware: Wizards seems hesitant to create a decent digital game. At its core, Magic: The Gathering is a social experience meant to be enjoyed with friends, sharing laughter, trash talk, and game-winning moments. Unfortunately, Wizards of the Coast appears to have lost sight of this. When playing with friends, you're unable to earn gold, which is a crucial aspect of the game. Gold is so vital that a daily cap has been implemented, likely to prevent the unlocking of all in-game content. However, be prepared for a lengthy and monotonous 1v1 grind against the computer or random opponents, with whom you can't even communicate. If you opt to play for free, expect to spend around 4 hours a day, solo, for over a month to unlock the cards.

original: Being the 3rd installment in the trilogy i'll get the bad stuff out of the way first. I quite hate pre-quals as it's technically going backwards in a story and not forwards (this is an issue for every pre-qual). Granted it offers more storywise. The combat feels sloppy and doesn't feel as sharp as arkham city managed to make it. As of writing this recommendation (26/10/2013) there is a game breaking bug that stops a side mission from ever being completed (main story not effected). Some gadgets are put at a rediculous hotkey that makes your hand have to travel the whole keyboard to get to it. It might sound like nothing, but while in combat it could potentially break your combo.
polished: As the third installment in the trilogy, I'll address the drawbacks first. I generally dislike prequels, as they technically move the story backward rather than forward, which is a common issue with prequels. However, they do offer additional storytelling opportunities. The combat feels somewhat sloppy and lacks the sharpness that Arkham City achieved. At the time of writing this review (26/10/2013), a game-breaking bug exists that prevents the completion of a side mission, although the main storyline remains unaffected. Some gadgets are assigned to inconvenient hotkeys, requiring excessive keyboard navigation, which can disrupt combos during combat.

original: They basically fixed shadow warrior (2013) i.e. The bossfights are awesome, weapons feel very nice (maybe not as good as d44m's ones, but still solid), enemies aren't too spongy (if you're not too much of a retard with handling elemental and upgrade stuff). The upgrade system is really balanced and once you get around it, it's not too tedious. The elemental stuff and limited ammo softly forces you to use different weapons. Lots of cool unique (being the important word here while comparing sw2 to ♥♥♥♥♥♥ borderlands' formula of 'rng' weapons) weapons that stay viable through most of the game. The music is great, especially the main theme and of course stan bush's stuff.
polished: They essentially perfected Shadow Warrior (2013) - the boss fights are impressive, the weapons feel great, although perhaps not quite as exceptional as those in D44M, but still solid nonetheless. Enemies aren't overly resilient, provided you're not mismanaging elemental and upgrade aspects. The upgrade system is well-balanced, and once you grasp it, it's not overly tedious. The elemental mechanics and limited ammo subtly encourage the use of diverse weapons. There are numerous unique and cool weapons that remain viable throughout most of the game, a notable distinction from the 'rng' formula found in Borderlands. The music is excellent, particularly the main theme and, of course, Stan Bush's contributions.

original: So many things was made wrong. I even dont know how to start this review. This all is refered to mycareer. My player is an outside scorer, pg, 1.71m, has maxed stats and got already all necessary perks. Ok, and now tell me, why the shooting skill depends to a person's hight? why a person who has 1.74m can not became so good in shooting as a person with 1.71m? i'm 1.87m in rl, made my first player with this hight and noticed then i can not reach a higher skill than 89. Why? thats a pure discrimination! and why the game does not tell me that before i create a char and not even then when i reach the skill limit after weeks of playing?!?
polished: There are numerous issues with the game. I'm struggling to find a starting point for this review, which primarily concerns my career mode experience. My player is an outside scorer, a point guard, standing at 1.71m, with maxed-out stats and all necessary perks. I'm perplexed as to why shooting skill is tied to a player's height. Why can't a player at 1.74m achieve the same level of shooting proficiency as one at 1.71m? In real life, I'm 1.87m tall, and when I created my first player with this height, I discovered that I couldn't exceed a shooting skill of 89. This seems unfair and discriminatory. Furthermore, why doesn't the game inform players of these height-related limitations before character creation or even when they reach the skill cap after weeks of playing?

original: I think this assassin's creed nailed the mechanics down on all fronts (ship battles, sailing, hunting (fish), parkour, etc). I felt much more attached to this character as well. The story starts out extremely rough but does get much much better as you play (i think this is with every ac game personally). Edward was quite the interesting character and so was all the side characters. I felt like all the collectables actually meant something in this ac game that i never got from any of the previous ones and maybe its because i felt like they had a bigger purpose in the game. They def were not required but they were fun to get and you got rewarded in a very balanced way.
polished: I believe this Assassin's Creed installment has successfully refined its mechanics across the board, including ship battles, sailing, hunting, parkour, and more. I found myself more invested in the protagonist than in previous games. Although the story begins on a rough note, it significantly improves as you progress, a trend I've noticed in every AC game. Edward proved to be a fascinating character, as were the supporting cast. Notably, the collectibles in this game felt more meaningful and purposeful than in previous installments, perhaps due to their greater significance in the overall narrative. While not required, they were enjoyable to obtain and provided a well-balanced reward system.

original: While i personally cannot recommend this game, it wasn't absolutely terrible. The gunplay is alright, so long as you have the money to purchase gun parts, which would be my main complaint with this game: it's pay-to-win. If i could get past that, the game would be enjoyable, as the hardsuit is fun to use and hrv is an excellent idea. I'd take this game over any call of duty title any day, but its pay-to-win microtransanction format is off-putting for me. If you are alright with this model, then by all means, have fun. But if you're like me and dislike pay-to-win games, just let this one slide; it's not our cup of tea.
polished: While I personally can't recommend this game, it's not entirely terrible. The gunplay is decent, provided you have the means to purchase gun parts, which is my primary concern: the game's pay-to-win model. If I could overlook this, the game would be enjoyable, as the hardsuit is fun to use and the HRV concept is excellent. I'd choose this game over any Call of Duty title, but the pay-to-win microtransaction format is off-putting for me. If you're comfortable with this model, then by all means, enjoy the game. However, if you're like me and dislike pay-to-win games, it's best to pass on this one; it's not our cup of tea.

original: While not perfect, this game has been greatly enjoyable. The save system and possibility of sudden death leads to some frustration. I'm on my first playthrough and i lost my main character around hour 10 of 20ish. Would have really liked a save to reload at that point. I've since picked up a 3rd party mod/save tool to avoid catastrophic failures. Plus the aiming reticule is on the small side and zoom is underpowered. With all that said, its been a blast. I'm not normally a zombie fan, but the combination of strategy, missions, first person shooter/beat em up is great. I've been playing it as often as i can get away... Just one more mission, just one more supply run - or i'm running away and want to get safe before shutting the game down.
polished: While not perfect, this game has been incredibly enjoyable. The save system and risk of sudden death can be frustrating at times. During my first playthrough, I lost my main character around the 10-hour mark of a 20-hour campaign, and I would have appreciated the option to reload from a previous save. To mitigate such losses, I've resorted to using a third-party mod and save tool. Additionally, the aiming reticule is somewhat small, and the zoom feature could be more powerful. Despite these issues, the game has been a blast. As someone who isn't typically a fan of zombie games, I've been drawn in by the combination of strategy, missions, and first-person shooter and beat-em-up elements. I find myself playing as often as possible, always tempted to complete just one more mission or supply run before shutting down the game.

original: An absolute great stragtegy game! having played every single other wargame (european escalation, and alb), i have to say this one fits well. The number of units are great. Not sure exactly how many units there are, but there's a crap ton!!! graphics are just beautiful, sounds are great, and the gameplay overall is epic. The ingame chat box at the main menu is very entertaining as well, no i am not kidding. However, if anyone thinking this game is 'easy', or if you are new to the strategy genre, it could take you quite some time to get it nailed down. Do not get upset, you will lose a lot of units. Just make sure you plan ahead, always have anti-air, and anti-tank.
polished: An absolutely great strategy game. Having played every other wargame, including European Escalation and ALB, I must say this one fits in perfectly. The vast number of units is impressive, with a staggering amount available. The graphics are stunning, the sounds are great, and the overall gameplay is epic. The in-game chat box at the main menu is also surprisingly entertaining. However, if you think this game is 'easy' or are new to the strategy genre, be prepared to invest significant time in mastering it. Don't get discouraged by losses - you will lose many units. Just remember to plan ahead, always have anti-air and anti-tank defenses in place.

original: I was negatively biased towards this game before i played it. Wasn't even sure about buying. I dunno, the whole portal gun and portals thing seemed weird to me even though i like science fiction. Boy was i wrong. The jokes and voice acting in this game is phenomenal. Just amazing. It's not cheesy (ok it's sometimes cheesy). And different story characters have all their own sense of humour. Those different characters do really have different personalities. And the level design; it's just rad. Btw i never played the first portal game. One of these days, i'm planning to if i can spare the time. I would never have played it if i hadn't played the sequel.
polished: I had a strong negative bias towards this game before playing it, and I was even hesitant to buy it. The concept of the portal gun and portals seemed unusual to me, despite my fondness for science fiction. However, I was pleasantly surprised. The jokes and voice acting in this game are truly phenomenal - just amazing. While it can be a bit cheesy at times, the humor is generally well-executed. Each story character has their own distinct sense of humor, and their unique personalities shine through. The level design is also impressive. Notably, I hadn't played the first Portal game before diving into the sequel, but I plan to do so when I have the time. In fact, playing the sequel is what sparked my interest in going back to play the original.

original: Ok lets start on the pros(+) and cons(-) then my thoughts on this game. +some of the best charecters +good story +lods of content +customisible charecter ( you can be male or female whatever you like) +you can have a relationship with most of your companions(yes fangirls you can have a love intrest) -bad graphics ( i dont think graphics really matter anyway) -weird and akward love scenes -invisible walls -theirs one mission in my opinion was boring but everyone has different tastes -+ um this isnt really bad or good but for those who care your protaginist you made cant talk okay know for my thoughts. I love this game. This game is probubly one of the best rpgs or games in general i have ever played.so if your a rpg fan you proubly already have this game.
polished:
- Subpar graphics, although I don't think this significantly impacts the overall experience
- Awkward and uncomfortable love scenes
- Invisible walls that can be frustrating
- One mission that I found boring, but opinions may vary

It's also worth noting that your protagonist is a silent character, which may or may not be a concern for some players.

As for my thoughts, I thoroughly enjoy this game. In my opinion, it's one of the best RPGs I've ever played, and possibly one of the best games in general. If you're an RPG fan, you likely already have this game in your collection.

original: Yes, this is a nostalgia trip for thirty-somethings who remember (at least in the uk) watching the ever-irritating timmy mallet just for the five minute transformers cartoon. The voice actors for optimus, megatron, bumblebee, and many others are back, and instantly recognisable. The distinctive cartoon transformation sound is there. Graphically, the cell-shaded presentation is perfect, and very, very generation one. But aside from that, it's actually a very fun game. The combat mechanics are extremely well done. Transforming mid-fight is often a necessity, and woven seamlessly into combos, making it quite unlike high moon's excellent war for/fall of cybertron games. Another distinction is the heavy focus on melee combat, but some enemies (e.g. Seekers) require a switch to a ranged blaster.
polished: This game is a nostalgic treat for thirty-somethings who recall watching the Transformers cartoon in the UK, if only to endure the annoying Timmy Mallet for those five precious minutes. The voice actors for iconic characters like Optimus, Megatron, and Bumblebee have returned, and their voices are instantly recognisable. The classic cartoon transformation sound effect is also present. The cell-shaded graphics are flawless and quintessentially Generation One. Beyond the nostalgic value, the game is genuinely enjoyable. The combat mechanics are exceptionally well-executed, with mid-fight transformations often being a necessity that seamlessly integrates into combos, setting it apart from High Moon's excellent War for/Fall of Cybertron games. Another notable distinction is the emphasis on melee combat, although certain enemies, such as the Seekers, require a switch to a ranged blaster.

original: So i downloaded the game and played it for a little while, and it was nothing special. I spent more time trying to log in though than actually playing the game. There is a bug where it says that there was an update to the terms of service or whatever and whenever you clicked 'accept' it would just pop up again. You have to restart the client for it to work. Now that isn't that bad but why do i need to link my steam and gface accounts? they say it is for dlc but why is that even necessary? it is also not reversable so now i know that a company i don't care about has access to my steam information. Now the game itself is so so. It is easily recognisable as a cod clone, except somehow they made the gunplay worse... How is that even possible?
polished: I downloaded the game and played it briefly, but it didn't leave a lasting impression. However, I spent more time trying to log in than actually playing, due to a bug that repeatedly prompted me to accept the updated terms of service. The issue was resolved only after restarting the client. What I found more concerning was the requirement to link my Steam and Gface accounts, supposedly for DLC purposes. I fail to see the necessity of this, and the fact that it's irreversible is unsettling, as it grants a company I'm not familiar with access to my Steam information. As for the game itself, it's mediocre and clearly inspired by Call of Duty, yet somehow manages to have inferior gunplay – a surprising feat in itself.

original: 4k+ at 60fps (gtx 970), dual audio options and includes neptune gear. What's not to love? https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nygsb617tmo excellent port and a great entry point if new to the series. Just keep in mind there is lots of (skip-able) talking. As usual would suggest using a gamepad but personally i had no problems with a keymouse/mouse setup, both completely rebindable. Price is about right and wouldn't have been unhappy about a purchase. More then half the dlc is included free, which is still plenty to play with. Recommended game to all jrpg/anime/visualnovel fans, provided you don't mind long breaks between the action. Cheers. No commentary playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=plslfvijaupszez9af395mvnk63xnhsj1_
polished: 4K at 60fps (GTX 970), dual audio options, and Neptune gear are all included - what's not to love? https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nygsb617tmo This is an excellent port and a great entry point for newcomers to the series. Just be aware that there's a significant amount of (skippable) dialogue. As usual, I recommend using a gamepad, but I personally had no issues with a keyboard and mouse setup, both of which are fully rebindable. The price is reasonable, and I wouldn't have been disappointed with a purchase. More than half of the DLC is included for free, providing plenty of content to play with. I highly recommend this game to all JRPG, anime, and visual novel fans, provided you don't mind the occasional long breaks between action sequences. Cheers. No commentary playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=plslfvijaupszez9af395mvnk63xnhsj1_

original: I experienced no performance problems even at release, and after all these patches it plays really well. Imo, this is a really great and fun game in truth, although the format may be somewhat annoying (where the free-roam city area repopulates with new enemies every time you progress the story). I particularly enjoyed the 'dual play' segments (where you can play batman + 1 more), and the ability to use the controller for most segments of the game but the mouse and keyboard for the tank combat segments was greatly appreciated. Driving your batmobile around the free-roam city, including when chasing the apc commanders, is actually quite enjoyable once you figure out how to use the breaks to skid around corners (and when you master that, driving around the city is really quite enjoyable!)
polished: I encountered no performance issues at launch, and with the numerous patches, the game runs smoothly. In my opinion, this is a truly great and enjoyable game, despite the somewhat frustrating format where the free-roam city area repopulates with new enemies upon progressing through the story. I particularly enjoyed the 'dual play' segments, which allow you to play as Batman alongside another character. The option to use a controller for most of the game, while switching to mouse and keyboard for tank combat segments, was a welcome feature. Driving the Batmobile around the free-roam city, including during APC commander chases, is quite enjoyable once you master the use of brakes to skid around corners, making navigation through the city a truly enjoyable experience.

original: Damn fine aaa fps shooter - that's the bottom line. It's looks, sounds and plays great - great fps mechanics, nice story, cool characters, flawless voice acting, and a badass soundtrack. Not for the faint hearted though - some of those cutscenes were pretty darn cruel and vivid. But when a game overall is so great, it's easier to spot the flaws, and here they are as i saw 'em: - no sli support - wtf? i had to put the game away until i upgraded my card, as it ran too poorly on my old dual gpu gtx 590. Make sure you have a fairly decent single gpu card. - stupidly small obstacles are often unclimbable.
polished: This game is a damn fine AAA FPS shooter - that's the bottom line. It boasts impressive visuals, exceptional sound design, and outstanding gameplay - with great FPS mechanics, an engaging story, cool characters, flawless voice acting, and a killer soundtrack. However, it's not for the faint of heart, as some cutscenes can be quite brutal and vivid. When a game is this great, its flaws become more noticeable, and here are the ones I encountered: - The lack of SLI support is baffling; I had to put the game on hold until I upgraded my graphics card, as it struggled to run smoothly on my old dual-GPU GTX 590. Make sure you have a decent single-GPU card. - Some ridiculously small obstacles can be frustratingly unclimbable.

original: English is not my native language. I am dutch. So please ignore any typing/grammatical mistakes in my review of this fantastic game. I will break down this review in a few categories: - graphics - controls - sound - gameplay - replayability - graphics: the game has been set in a comic-like style. The graphics are very slick: no unnecussery details. Nice colour-scemes. It totally works for this game. The graphics can be set on 'high' without stressing your system. I run this game on an i5 pentium processor, with nvidia geforce 710m card - 8gb memory and it runs like clockwork (windows 8.1). - controls: the game can be played with keyboard and mouse, but also with an x-box controller.
polished:
I am not a native English speaker, as Dutch is my native language. Please disregard any typing or grammatical errors in my review of this fantastic game. I will break down this review into several categories: graphics, controls, sound, gameplay, and replayability. 

Graphics: The game features a comic-like style, with very slick graphics that avoid unnecessary details. The color schemes are nice, and this aesthetic works well for the game. The graphics can be set to 'high' without putting excessive strain on your system. I run the game on an i5 Pentium processor, with an Nvidia GeForce 710m card and 8GB of memory, and it runs smoothly (Windows 8.1).

Controls: The game can be played using either a keyboard and mouse or an Xbox controller.

original: You can see by the hours i put into this game that i enjoy it. This is everything i wished a search game from cod would be. But dont buy this game thinking its like cod, battlefield, or any other shooter game. Its a game in its own class and should be treated as such. Cant tell you how many times i hear new players ♥♥♥♥♥ and complain about getting killed really fast. Oh god forbid you get shot in the face and ♥♥♥♥ing die. It's not like that doents happen in real life or anything. Edit:ok so ive been playing this game for awhile now. Thrown all kinds of money at it. One of the best mp games around. A good thing to play when your your not feeling cs:go.
polished: You can tell by the hours I've invested in this game that I thoroughly enjoy it. This is everything I had hoped a search game from the Call of Duty series would be. However, don't purchase this game expecting it to be similar to Call of Duty, Battlefield, or any other shooter game. It's a unique game that stands on its own and should be treated as such. I've lost count of how many times I've heard new players express frustration and complain about being killed quickly. It's almost as if they're shocked to be shot and killed, despite this being a realistic outcome. It's worth noting that this can happen in real life as well. Edit: After playing this game for a while now and investing a significant amount of money, I can confidently say it's one of the best multiplayer games around. It's a great alternative to play when you're not in the mood for CS:GO.

original: I'm 2 hours in and am dying from this game. So funny. Gameplay is also solid, art design is beautiful, music is surprisingly high quality and appropriate, the story/world has me interested, and the puzzles are fun. But the best thing about this game beyond all that is the comedy. If you've played any rpg since the dawn of video game rpgs you will laugh at the various jokes, parodies, and references; if you've never played an rpg before then you should still enjoy the game for its humor. If you played final fantasy 7 or x you absolutely need to play this game, without giving too much away... I had to actually stop playing after 2 hours to give my cheeks a break from laughing and smiling so much. What a delight so far.
polished: I'm two hours in and utterly enthralled by this game. The humor is hilarious, and the gameplay is solid. The art design is stunning, the music is surprisingly high-quality and fitting, the story and world have piqued my interest, and the puzzles are enjoyable. However, what truly sets this game apart is its comedic genius. If you're a seasoned RPG player, you'll appreciate the numerous jokes, parodies, and references that will have you laughing out loud. Even if you're new to RPGs, the game's humor is still sure to entertain. If you've played Final Fantasy 7 or X, this game is an absolute must-play – without giving too much away, I had to pause after two hours to give my cheeks a break from all the smiling and laughing. So far, it's been an absolute delight.

original: I'm really sorry, i try to be supportive of free-to-play games and indie developers, but i really didn't enjoy this game. The description sounded right up my alley, but the execution has done nothing for me. I love puzzle and exploration games, but i found this game to be completely unintuitive, and even after looking up how to progress i still just simply didn't find the gameplay itself fun. It also completely lacks a pause button, or if it does have one i never found it. Considering that a lot of sequences in the game are timed, this seems like a critical oversight. I also feel like this game is a lot more cut scene than it is game, and i end up just sitting around drumming my fingers a lot.
polished: I apologize, but I must admit that I was disappointed with this game, despite my efforts to support free-to-play titles and indie developers. The description initially resonated with me, but the execution fell short. As a fan of puzzle and exploration games, I was surprised to find this game completely unintuitive, and even after seeking guidance, I couldn't find the gameplay enjoyable. Furthermore, the absence of a pause button, or at least one that I could find, seems like a significant oversight, particularly given the timed sequences. Unfortunately, I felt that the game was overly reliant on cutscenes, leaving me with extended periods of inactivity, waiting for the next interactive segment.

original: This game.... Phew where to even start. It was absolutely beautiful, from story to graphics i was hooked. The story wasnt just some story but actually felt like i was that person, trying to figure out what came next in the story that my character was telling. Gameplay was great and i learned alot about myself through this game (mainly my fear of hights which i never had a problem with until the ice caverns). My gut churned the whole time, but i kept through for uncle fred! if you guys made a dlc or second game, i would be the first to buy it and recomend it to everyone i know. Thanks to everyone who was involved making this, you made a absolutely beautiful game.
polished: This game left me breathless - I'm still trying to process where to begin. It was stunningly beautiful, from the captivating storyline to the impressive graphics, I was completely enthralled. The narrative wasn't just a generic tale, but rather an immersive experience that made me feel like I was the protagonist, eagerly anticipating the next twist in the story. The gameplay was exceptional, and I gained valuable insights about myself, particularly my unexpected fear of heights, which was triggered by the ice caverns. My stomach was in knots throughout, but my determination to help Uncle Fred kept me going. If a DLC or sequel is in the works, I'd be the first in line to purchase it and wholeheartedly recommend it to everyone I know. A huge thank you to the entire team involved in creating this masterpiece - you've truly crafted a beautiful game.

original: Sid meier's civilization beyond earth is a turn-based game in which you build your civilization to a certain goal or 'victory'. In previous games you were set on the earth's timeline going through periods like the stone age, medieval age, and the modern age; however, in this game you are set in the future on a mission to colonize a new planet. What i enjoy about this game is 2k took a new approach to the game and added some new mechanics such as the affinity system and orbital layer. What i didn't enjoy was that with these new mechanics the game could be overwhelming at times. What think could be improved on this game is that they could maybe incorperate some new artwork in the game such as the enviroment you experience when communicating with another leader.
polished: Sid Meier's Civilization: Beyond Earth is a turn-based game where you build your civilization to achieve a specific goal or 'victory'. Unlike previous games, which followed the Earth's timeline through periods such as the Stone Age, Medieval Age, and Modern Age, this game takes place in the future, where you're on a mission to colonize a new planet. What I appreciate about this game is that 2K took a fresh approach and introduced new mechanics, such as the affinity system and orbital layer. However, I found that these new features could sometimes make the game feel overwhelming. One potential area for improvement is incorporating new artwork, such as more immersive environments for diplomatic interactions with other leaders.

original: Great game ! tons of replayability and very fun zombie survival game ! def. In my top 5 zombie games ever played. Edit: after playing 60+ hours i can honestly say this is one of the better more ''realistic'' zombie games. It's very much designed like a survival horror as you must save up your ammo, heal your own wounds when you bleed out, take pills when youre infected, etc. Also, i find zombies to feel very natual to be well animated for a free to play game. P.s. : i would recomend getting 1 or 2 friends to play with, but the community is super friendly and you can usually make friends/talk with the people in the chat or over voice comms.
polished: Great game with tons of replay value and an incredibly fun zombie survival experience. It's definitely among my top 5 zombie games of all time. After investing over 60 hours, I can confidently say that this is one of the better, more realistic zombie games out there. Its design is reminiscent of a survival horror, where you must conserve ammo, treat your own wounds, and take medication when infected. The zombie animations are surprisingly natural and well-done, especially considering it's a free-to-play game. One recommendation I'd make is to play with one or two friends, but the community is extremely friendly, making it easy to make friends or chat with others via voice comms or in-game chat.

original: 02/07/2014 - it's a shame i can't thoroughly recommend/enjoy this game as from the short time i've played it,i know i'd be addicted if it didn't have the following 2 game breakers. . No aussie servers - one red bar puts you at a severe disadvantage,and creates unbearable lag. Mind you,i played through the offline training mode and it was stuttering/lagging as well (how does that even happen?). Couple that with the poor ping,and it just ruins the game. . Everything artifacts like crazy - the menu's,backgrounds,training and in-game. I've never had this happen before with this card and thought it might not like my oc. Set my gpu back to stock and sure enough,it didn't make a difference.
polished: 02/07/2014 - Unfortunately, I'm unable to wholeheartedly recommend or enjoy this game due to two major issues that I've encountered during my brief playtime. Firstly, the lack of Australian servers is a significant drawback, as a single red bar results in a substantial disadvantage and unbearable lag. Notably, even the offline training mode was plagued by stuttering and lag, which is perplexing. When combined with poor ping, the overall gaming experience is severely compromised. Secondly, the game is marred by excessive artifacting, affecting menus, backgrounds, training, and in-game visuals. I've never experienced this issue with my graphics card before, and I initially suspected that it might be related to my overclocking settings. However, reverting my GPU to its stock settings did not resolve the problem.

original: Very late last night i finished this. The story is not very deep or interesting but what makes it stand out is the story-telling. The atmosphere is filled to the brim and the many collectibles do a great job at fleshing it out. I did learn a lot about the world of batman so it was a little disappointing that so few bosses were in the game. Oh well, there's enough future games to rectify that. The combat is the right amount of challenge but it's more on the easy side. Leveling up batman wasn't very satisfying. It's the gadgets you upgrade and acquire during the campaign which add for nice new gameplay mechanics. Getting access to previously unreachable places makes for a nice sense of progression.
polished: I completed this late last night. Although the story isn't particularly deep or engaging, the storytelling is what sets it apart. The atmosphere is richly detailed, and the numerous collectibles do an excellent job of fleshing it out. I gained a lot of insight into the world of Batman, which made the limited number of bosses in the game somewhat disappointing. However, there are plenty of future games that can address this issue. The combat strikes a good balance of challenge, albeit on the easier side. Leveling up Batman wasn't particularly satisfying, but upgrading and acquiring new gadgets throughout the campaign added nice new gameplay mechanics. Gaining access to previously inaccessible areas provided a nice sense of progression.

original: 'to the moon' is no mere game... Nay, it is a veritable experience, and it was one of the best of my life at that. Think telltale's the walking dead is sad? hohoho! well, it's no match for to the moon! never before have i been so depressed yet fulfilled over something purely fictional. This masterpiece represents the pinnacle of storytelling in my opinion, and the soundtrack is a gorgeously charming and perfect accompaniment. Yes, the controls are a bit finicky and the gameplay is not the strong point, but the story is so fantastic that i did not care one bit. Plus, the humor of the game is great as well and it definitely does not intrude upon the distinguished nature of the story... And the doctor who references are endless.
polished: 'To the Moon' is no mere game... Nay, it is a veritable experience, and it ranks among the best of my life. While Telltale's 'The Walking Dead' is undoubtedly sad, it pales in comparison to the emotional depth of 'To the Moon'. Never before have I felt so simultaneously depressed and fulfilled by something purely fictional. In my opinion, this masterpiece represents the pinnacle of storytelling, with a gorgeously charming and perfect soundtrack to complement it. Although the controls can be finicky and the gameplay is not its strong suit, the story is so fantastic that I didn't care. The game's humor is also noteworthy, and it seamlessly integrates with the narrative without detracting from its distinguished nature. Furthermore, the numerous 'Doctor Who' references are a delightful bonus.

original: Bastion is a bloody brilliant game, with a really great storyline. Set after some calamity happened, you start to rebuild on the bastion. There's quite a lot of choice in the game, with the choice of what to build to give you an advantage, what weapons to use and what power ups to have on those weapons as well as what drinks to use to give you a bonus effect. The art style and music in the game is fantastic, everything looks so colourful at times, who says the apocolypse has to be dull. Best of all, the game has narration based on what you, the player do. So if you end up picking up a weapon then switch it for another in the armoury, the narration would say something of you taking along the new weapon.
polished: Bastion is a truly exceptional game, boasting a captivating storyline. Set in a post-calamity world, you embark on rebuilding the bastion. The game offers a considerable amount of choice, allowing you to decide what to build to gain an advantage, which weapons to wield, and what power-ups to equip them with, as well as selecting drinks that grant bonus effects. The art style and music are fantastic, with vibrant visuals that defy the notion that a post-apocalyptic world must be dull. One of the standout features is the dynamic narration, which responds to the player's actions, such as switching between weapons in the armoury, prompting the narrator to comment on the new choice.

original: I had originally bought this game in early development, when the only currency was spacebux, and there was no 'tech tree'. This was when the game was good. All of the guns at this point were equally overpowered, so there was no problems with imbalance; everyone could kill everyone at any time. Also, the game used to give you unlimited gun slots and five loadouts. You would think that for a game with 'bajillions of guns', they would at least give you more than 6 weapon slots and 3 loadouts before you have to pay to get more. At one point, i had about 3 pages worth of guns, and was planning on new ideas for more, because personally, that's where i found it fun.
polished: I initially purchased this game during its early development stages, when the sole currency was spacebux and there was no 'tech tree'. This was the period when the game truly shone. At that point, all guns were equally overpowered, eliminating any balance issues; players could take each other down at any time. Furthermore, the game offered unlimited gun slots and five loadouts, allowing for greater flexibility. Given the game's claim of having 'bajillions of guns', it's surprising that players are now limited to just six weapon slots and three loadouts, with additional slots and loadouts available only through purchase. I once had an extensive collection of guns, spanning about three pages, and was brainstorming new ideas, as that's where I found the game to be the most enjoyable.

original: This game was a surprising gem. One often sees rave reviews of certain products that are often misleading. In this case, the reviews reflect the fun of this neat little game. It is an odd mix between a classic 2d platformer and an moba, and does it with style. I found myself enjoying characters that i wouldn't enjoy in other moba games. I had expected this trait to continue, but decided to give a melee tank a go anyway. I was pleasantly surprised with the outcome and ended up trying out more as they were unlocked from playing games. The art style and interface is oddly charming. As such, i now use one of the characters as my avatar and a wallpaper from creating a card set for the game.
polished: This game was a surprising gem, defying the often misleading rave reviews associated with certain products. In this case, the reviews accurately reflect the fun of this neat little game, which masterfully blends the classic 2D platformer with the MOBA genre, pulling it off with style. I found myself enjoying characters that I wouldn't typically appreciate in other MOBA games. Initially, I had expected this preference to hold, but I decided to give a melee tank a try anyway. The outcome was pleasantly surprising, and I ended up experimenting with more characters as they were unlocked through gameplay. The art style and interface have an oddly charming quality to them. As a result, I've adopted one of the characters as my avatar and even created a wallpaper from a card set inspired by the game.

original: I just started playing, but i love this game. I put on my headphone and lose myself in the game for hours at a time. It's been awhile since a game has had that effect on me. The music sets the mood, the sound effects are right on, and the controls are perfect. I look forward to every combat, and they've optimized combat extremely well. I had my doubt about the navel combat system, but it is so much fun to lay waste to multiple fleets at a time! the only way to lose in this game is to fail to retreat. If the combat looks overwhelming just get outta there, regroup, and counter-assault. Thanks, devs, for an awesome experience!
polished: I've just started playing, but I'm already hooked on this game. With my headphones on, I can easily lose myself in the game for hours on end. It's been a while since a game has had such a profound effect on me. The music perfectly sets the mood, the sound effects are spot on, and the controls are flawless. I eagerly anticipate every combat encounter, and the developers have clearly optimized the combat system to near perfection. Initially, I had my doubts about the naval combat system, but it's incredibly enjoyable to take down multiple fleets at once. The key to success lies in knowing when to retreat - if a battle seems overwhelming, it's best to regroup and launch a counterattack. Thanks to the developers for creating such an amazing experience!

original: The reboot of the devil may cry franchise has brought about many changes for the series, particularly for series’ protagonist, dante. While fans of the original series may be upset at the change to their beloved character, it’s certainly for the better; and this new game by ninja theory proves it. Dmc serves as the perfect point for newcomers to jump into the series. It shows the origins of an arrogant, cynical dante, and it chronicles his journey from cynicism to selflessness. Throughout, the game weaves a clear, narrative arc for the new dante, making him a compelling character to watch.image the story follows dante as he’s introduced into the corrupt world he willfully chose to ignore.
polished: The reboot of the Devil May Cry franchise has introduced significant changes to the series, particularly for its protagonist, Dante. Although fans of the original series may be disheartened by the transformation of their beloved character, it is undoubtedly an improvement, as evident in this new game by Ninja Theory. DmC serves as an ideal entry point for newcomers to the series, showcasing the origins of a once arrogant and cynical Dante, and chronicling his journey from cynicism to selflessness. Throughout the game, a clear narrative arc is woven for the new Dante, rendering him a compelling character to watch. The story follows Dante as he is thrust into the corrupt world he had previously chosen to ignore.

original: Where do i start on this absolutely beautiful game. It's story, is absolutely charming. It has so much detail put into it, and it is a bundle of happiness, bad puns, annoying dogs, secrets. It is serious when it needs to be, but isn't a stranger to funny moments. The character design is on point, with there being various characters with various personailities and secrets to them. It sticks out from other rpg's because you don't have to kill anyone, which is an unused concept in rpg's. With lots of inspiration from earthbound, one of the best rpg's i have seen, you can tell that it is going to be good. It easily has the best soundtrack i've heard in forever.
polished: Where do I even begin with this absolutely captivating game? Its story is undeniably charming, boasting an impressive level of detail and a delightful blend of happiness, humor, and intrigue. The game seamlessly balances its tone, shifting between serious moments and lighthearted humor with ease. The character design is exceptional, featuring a diverse cast with unique personalities and secrets waiting to be uncovered. What sets it apart from other RPGs is its refreshing approach, allowing players to progress without the need for violence – a concept rarely explored in the genre. Drawing inspiration from the beloved Earthbound, it's clear that this game is something special. The soundtrack, in particular, is outstanding, standing out as one of the best I've heard in a long time.

original: I am recommending this solely because it's free, and might be a more 'enjoyable' experience for others. As for my experience, the 'game' did nothing for me. Half the story relies on shock factor. I was not shocked nor emotionally moved in any way by this. Maybe i'm desensitized, or maybe it was too simple to warrant a reaction out of me. As for the other half of the game, it tries to paint a picture (literally) of a person in mental decline. It deals with obsession, hallucination, depression and a few other things. In theory it is a cool idea. But the 'game' took me 10 minutes to complete, and that is with reading and taking in every little bit of information i could.
polished: I'm recommending this solely because it's free, and it might offer a more enjoyable experience for others. However, personally, the game had little impact on me. Half of the story relies heavily on shock value, which failed to elicit any emotional response from me. I'm either desensitized to such tactics or the execution was too simplistic to evoke a reaction. The other half of the game attempts to portray a person's mental decline through a series of visual representations, exploring themes like obsession, hallucination, and depression. While the concept is intriguing in theory, the game's brevity – it took me only 10 minutes to complete, even with thorough reading and absorption of all available information – undermines its potential.

original: Do i even need to explain why portal is amazing? portal is a puzzle game, it gives you a concept then gets out. It is an amazing way to test your mind while still being fun. Although this game isn't as story heavy, it did give birth to one of the most good popular games of 2011. I still play this game and beat it when i am feeling bored and i love to come back and to see what gave birth to a legend and what is a legend. Gameplay: portal's gameplay is quite simple, to explain at least. You use portals to your advantage, along with buttons that activate a part of the puzzle. Two buttons are in the game, one that you press and one that you need a cube to put on.
polished: Do I even need to explain why Portal is amazing? Portal is a puzzle game that introduces a concept and then steps aside, allowing you to take the reins. It's an incredible way to challenge your mind while still being entertaining. Although this game isn't as story-driven, it did give birth to one of the most popular games of 2011. I still play this game and beat it when I'm feeling bored, and I love to revisit it to see what spawned a legend and what has become a legend. Gameplay: Portal's gameplay is relatively simple to explain. You utilize portals to your advantage, along with buttons that activate a part of the puzzle. There are two types of buttons in the game: one that you press directly and another that requires a cube to be placed on it.

original: If you can overlook the bugs (which i personally only had two: one minor and the other quite annoying) edit: both bugs are resolved one fix increased my fps from 60-90 to 80-120 and are looking for a space exploration game, i can definitely recommend this. Since most of these reviews are about specs, i'll include mine: i5 6600k (~200€) radeon rx480 (~200€) z170 pro - gaming (~150€) 16gb ddr4 ram (~70€) ~650€ is definitely within the medium price range though, granted, this rig is quite new. Almost constant 60+ fps on high settings vsync enabled i genuinely can't believe 90% of the comments saying they're rocking an overkill setup and get 20fps.
polished: If you can overlook the bugs (which I personally experienced only two of: one minor and the other quite annoying, both of which have since been resolved), and you're in the market for a space exploration game, I highly recommend this one. As most reviews focus on system specs, I'll share mine: i5 6600k (~200€), Radeon RX480 (~200€), Z170 Pro Gaming (~150€), and 16GB DDR4 RAM (~70€), totaling ~650€, which falls within the medium price range. Although my rig is relatively new, I consistently achieve 60+ FPS on high settings with VSync enabled. I find it hard to believe that 90% of the comments claim to have overkill setups yet only manage 20 FPS.

original: Remember age of mythology? yeah, it's been that long since there's been an rts game of such quality. Divinity: dragon commander reaches awfully close to these borders of my personal most favourite rts game. Combine this with a huge risk-like grand strategy mode and there, it hit the spot. I am not (read: try not to be) overly biased due to the fact that this game allows you to turn into a dragon, aiding your troops by supporting, attacking and even commanding unit production, direction and spawning at the very same time. Honestly, i do like the complicated rts games nowadays. Think of civ v and so on. However, such games attempt to cram complex mechanics, charts and resources all into one complicated game mode.
polished: Remember Age of Mythology? It's been that long since an RTS game of such quality has been released. Divinity: Dragon Commander comes awfully close to surpassing my personal favorite RTS game. Combining this with a massive Risk-like grand strategy mode is the icing on the cake. I'm trying not to be overly biased, but the fact that this game allows you to transform into a dragon, supporting and commanding your troops while attacking and directing unit production and spawning, is a major draw. I've grown fond of complex RTS games like Civilization V, but those games often try to cram too many mechanics, charts, and resources into a single, convoluted game mode.

original: Undertale comes together to make something greater than the sum of its parts. The graphics are solid for a retro title and the music is nice, but paired together they make some truly beautiful and impacting moments. The script runs the gammut from comedic to dramatic to heartbreaking to hopeful, sometimes all at once, and does this while turning rpg tropes on their head. And all of this without touching on the world, characters, story, gameplay... I could write whole pages about it. But instead, i'll just say this: if you like rpgs, play this game. If you like video games, play this game. If you have seven free hours between now and your death, play this game.
polished: Undertale transcends the sum of its parts to create something truly remarkable. The solid retro graphics and pleasant music come together to form breathtaking and impactful moments. The script masterfully navigates a wide range of emotions, from comedic to dramatic to heartbreaking and hopeful, often simultaneously, while cleverly subverting RPG tropes. Without even delving into the world, characters, story, and gameplay, there's already so much to explore. But to put it simply: if you're an RPG fan, play this game. If you enjoy video games, play this game. If you have seven free hours to spare, play this game – it's an experience you won't regret.

original: If you liked witcher 1 and 2, witcher 3 is must to get. I would give normally for this game 10/10 but unfortunatly after 1.03 this game turned into buggy ♥♥♥♥ + random crashes, so remember to save really often. When i played version 1.00 -> 1.03 my game never crashed, i didnt see any bugs. Also i have noticed that after 1.03 patch drawing distance sometimes is horrible, starting to draw objects when youre really close, sometimes even people. But if forgetting all these bugs, crashes and drawdistance 'bugs', this is really fantastic game, they made huge effort on quests, some of them really emotional and deep, lots of side quests, and the fact that your decision effects a lot in this game. I have played over 50 hours now and still going on.
polished: If you enjoyed The Witcher 1 and 2, then The Witcher 3 is a must-have. I would normally give this game a 10/10, but unfortunately, after the 1.03 update, it became plagued by bugs and random crashes, so be sure to save frequently. When I played versions 1.00 to 1.03, my game never crashed, and I didn't encounter any bugs. However, I've noticed that after the 1.03 patch, the drawing distance can be poor at times, with objects and even people only loading when you're very close. Nevertheless, if you overlook these issues, this is a truly fantastic game. The developers made a huge effort on the quests, some of which are emotionally deep and impactful, with numerous side quests and a dynamic storyline where your decisions have significant consequences. Having played over 50 hours, I'm still thoroughly engaged and continuing to play.

original: I have only had this game for a few months, but in just that short amount of time, two dlc's have come out, along with patches that have made an already great game into an excellent one. The devs are very active in the community, and it really shows in the various discussion forums and dev diaries. There is a fairly steep learning curve to the game's mechanics of which i am still trying to learn; however, this breadth of strategy allows you a myriad of ways to reach goals and take advantage of certain situations. The game, in my mind, is almost infinitely replayable. I find myself sucked into every session i play regardless of how the play-through is going.
polished: I've had this game for just a few months, but in that short time, two DLCs have been released, along with patches that have transformed an already great game into an exceptional one. The developers are highly active in the community, and their engagement is evident in the discussion forums and dev diaries. While the game's mechanics have a fairly steep learning curve, which I'm still working to master, this depth of strategy offers a multitude of ways to achieve goals and capitalize on various situations. In my opinion, the game is nearly infinitely replayable. I find myself completely absorbed in every session, regardless of how the playthrough unfolds.

original: Warframe is a fun game for the first few hours of play. After those few enjoyable hours you'll begin to see that the only thing left the game has to offer is repetition in it's combat, enemies and game play. The one major high point for the game is that the developers are working hard and do semi-frequent updates that generally include a lot of content from sweeping changes to some of the game's systems, new warframes and other tweaks/features. It's a good game to play casually. Though i doubt it will hold your attention beyond a few months unless you just really like grinding. The upside to all of this is that the game is free so i'd recommend trying it out. If you're looking for a quick fix, try it out.
polished: Warframe is an enjoyable game for the initial few hours of play, offering an engaging experience. However, as time progresses, the game's limitations become apparent, with repetition in combat, enemies, and gameplay becoming the primary focus. A notable exception is the developers' dedication to regular updates, which often include substantial content additions, such as significant system overhauls, new warframes, and various tweaks and features. This makes Warframe suitable for casual play. Nevertheless, its ability to sustain long-term interest is questionable, unless you have a strong affinity for grinding. On the positive side, the game is free, making it worth trying out, especially if you're looking for a brief gaming fix.

original: This game is so.. Very.. Boring. I bought this game because i believed it was a pc version of 'katamari damacy', a popular and nice ps 2 game. Sadly it's far from it. In this game you go about, absorbing ever bigger things to grow bigger and absorb bigger things. But the gameplay isn't as smooth as it could be, the levels not inventive and what is in it is a surreal horror show. I don't mean an entertaining horror show but, one that makes you rather depressed and rethink whether being alive is all it should be. Every 'living' creature in this game from small pets to human beings makes me wonder if the creators of this game had an interest in taxidermy.
polished: This game is extremely dull. I purchased it under the impression that it was a PC version of 'Katamari Damacy', a popular and enjoyable PS2 game. Unfortunately, it falls far short of expectations. The gameplay involves absorbing increasingly larger objects to grow bigger and absorb even more, but the experience is marred by a lack of smoothness, unoriginal levels, and a surreal atmosphere that borders on horror. However, it's not the entertaining kind of horror, but rather a bleak and depressing one that makes you question the value of existence. The depiction of 'living' creatures, from small pets to humans, is unsettling, leaving me to wonder if the game's creators have a fascination with taxidermy.

original: Alright. Let me explain a few things, as a person very intrested in politics, i was very interested in this game when i first heard about it. I thought, 'oh wow! a simulator of the road to becoming president! that sounds fun!' well, it really wasn't. The game starts you off and says you need to pick a side: republican or democrat, there is no independent, or third party. A little dissapointed, but still optimistic, i carried on to see what i could do. I will give the game credit, the character customization, although limited, is pretty fun to mess around with. It's the only time its an option to wear your head or not in a campaign. Literally.
polished: Let me explain a few things. As someone very interested in politics, I was immediately drawn to this game when I first heard about it. I thought, 'Wow, a simulator of the road to becoming president - that sounds like a lot of fun!' Unfortunately, it didn't quite live up to my expectations. The game begins by asking you to choose a side: Republican or Democrat, with no option for an independent or third-party candidate. Although this was a bit disappointing, I remained optimistic and continued to see what the game had to offer. One aspect that deserves credit is the character customization, which, although limited, is enjoyable to experiment with. It's also amusing to have the option to wear a hat or not during a campaign - a unique touch, indeed.

original: Fallout 3 story was better. Settlements get in the way of the story to the point you'll hate baby sitting them instead of playing the story. Some keys are hard coded and cannot be rebound. Bugs galore. My pipboy disappeared permanently at one point and had to research console commands to get it back. You don't have to work for power armor it's basically given to you from the beginning of the game and power cores are everywhere in trader shops. Value of power armor diminished greatly from previous fallout games. Story is medicore, everything about this game is mediocre except it doesn't crash every 10 mins like fallout 3. Very stable compared to fallout 3. Is it better than fallout 3 no. Is it better than new vegas? no. This title was so overhyped for how bad it actually is.
polished: Fallout 3 had a superior storyline. The settlements in this game often detract from the narrative, making it feel like a chore to manage them instead of progressing through the story. Some key bindings are hardcoded and cannot be customized. The game is plagued by numerous bugs, including a frustrating incident where my Pip-Boy disappeared permanently, forcing me to resort to console commands to retrieve it. Power armor is readily available from the start, and power cores can be easily purchased from traders, significantly diminishing its value compared to previous Fallout games. The storyline is mediocre, and overall, the game feels average, except for its stability, which is a notable improvement over Fallout 3. However, it falls short of both Fallout 3 and New Vegas, making it a disappointing and overhyped title.

original: My stats (at the time of writing this review): - 8.6 hrs to get to the end - 10 collectibles found out of 25 - zero achievements out of 15 what i liked: - visuals up until the last level (ice caves) - story is not that great, but the ending (after the closing credits) kind of made me not regret so much spending my time playing this game what i disliked: - visuals in the last level are uninteresting - gameplay in the last level gets much harder making it become a frustrating experience of having to do a lot of things over and over again until you get it right - achievements are too hard. There are 13 (out of 15) that only less than 2,1% of players achieved!
polished: My stats at the time of writing this review were: 8.6 hours to complete the game, 10 collectibles found out of 25, and zero achievements out of 15. The aspects I enjoyed were: the visuals, which were impressive until the final level (ice caves), and although the story was not exceptional, the ending (following the closing credits) somewhat redeemed the time I invested in playing the game. On the other hand, I disliked: the unimpressive visuals in the final level, the significantly increased difficulty in the last level, which made the experience frustrating due to the need for repetition to achieve success, and the overly challenging achievements, with 13 out of 15 being achieved by less than 2.1% of players.

original: Pros: +graphic cons: -bugs(especially the environment, you may get stuck or your shots may hit a invisible wall despite having clear line of sight of the enemy) -game is handholding/ babysitting you -dumb ai -enemies always seem to know where you are when you are spotted -godlike accuracy by the enemy which is frustrating like the first ghost warrior. -terrible checkpoints and saves. -boring story that i couldn't care less about will not recommend it unless its 90% off even then i find playing this game to be an extremely boring chore, just playing for the sake of finishing it to move unto the next game in my library. Considering the time i wasted on the first ghost warrior (which was equally boring and i feel liberated when i finished it), i probably won't play it until the end.
polished: Pros: +graphics. Cons: -bugs, particularly in the environment, can cause issues such as getting stuck or hitting invisible walls despite having a clear line of sight to the enemy. -The game holds your hand excessively, making it feel overly guided. -The AI is unintelligent. -Enemies seem to always know your location once you're spotted. -Enemies have unrealistically high accuracy, which can be frustrating, similar to the first Ghost Warrior. -The checkpoint and save systems are poorly implemented. -The story is dull and unengaging, making it hard to care about the plot. I wouldn't recommend this game unless it's heavily discounted, even then, playing it feels like a chore. Having wasted time on the first Ghost Warrior, which was equally uninteresting and a relief to finish, I'm unlikely to complete this game, and will only play it to move on to the next title in my library.

Although I was able to play it, I enjoyed the experience. As the Steve Miller Band song goes: "Go on, take the money and run..." While my time with the game was limited, I was impressed.
